channel.title: Tham Le's Notes

item.title: virtual-keycode
item.description: The user is asking about the fundamental difference between virtual keycodes and Unicode characters.

item.title: why-utf-32
item.description: Excellent Point: Why Not UTF-8 Everywhere? You’re absolutely right to challenge this design choice.

item.title: Winit-Key-Reference
item.description: Excellent. That is the most important piece of information you could have given me.

item.title: Unicode-Implementation-Across-All-Layers
item.description: Overview Here’s every function/file you need to create or modify to add Unicode support to libkynput, organized by layer from bottom (protocol) to top (UI).

item.title: Unicode-Implementation-Guide
item.description: Based on the existing keyboard implementation, here’s how to add Unicode input support while maintaining the exact same coding style and architecture.

item.title: Unicode-Original-Notes
item.description: Of course. Let’s break this down. You’ve correctly identified that the server should be responsible for generating the repeats.
